title: How can I install Slimroms on my device?
content: Assuming you have a custom recovery on your device e.g. twrp you can follow our guide [here](https://slimroms.org/#/support/install)

title: Which gapps should I use with Slim?
content: We recommend using nano opengapps. You can get the gapps from their [website](http://opengapps.org/)

title: Can you support device 'X'?
content: We need the device in order to support it as well as a device maintainer willing to maintain it.
If you can't find your device in our [download section](https://slimroms.org/#/download) then it's not supported by us.
You can check your device's thread on xda-developers to see if someone built unofficial builds for your device.

title: Does Slim have Theme engine support?
content: On Slim6, we partially support RRO/Layers. However due to some backend changes, theming framework-res and systemUI might result in a bootloop. We currently **do not** support Substratum/OMS and have no immediate plans to do so.
On Slim7 we began to merge OMS support without masquerade support. The Substratum app will work as is. We have no immediate plans to add masquerade support.

title: I have a high battery drain with your Rom. What can I do?
content: In most cases, battery drain isn't caused by the Rom.
Occasionally, it can be caused by the first google sync just after configuring google account. or
by a badly coded or old app installed by the user.
Charge you device up to 100%, install better battery status (BBS) or similar app to closely monitor your device and check the reason for the drain.

title: Slim is not translated to my language, How can I help translating it?
content: You can help by Joining our [Crowdin Project.](https://crowdin.com/project/slimroms)
If you're unfamiliar with Crowdin check their [quick start guide](https://crowdin.com/page/quick-start) and choose I am a translator.

title: I really like Slimroms, How can I contribute?
content: We're an open source project so if you have any coding experience you can make changes, add features, fix bugs and submit them to our [gerrit.](http://review.slimroms.org/)
If you don't have any coding experience, You can help by sharing the word or [donating](https://goo.gl/ZZA2AT) to our project.
The donated money covers our server costs and gets us new devices to develop for and add to our officially supported devices

title: How can I be a device maintainer for 'X' device?
content: You can check out our [join team page](http://localhost/#/support/join-team)
